intro: Neisosperma poweri, commonly known as the yellow-flowered gooseberry, is a member of the Rutaceae family. It is a shrub characterized by its small, yellow flowers and red, fleshy fruits. The plant is native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. Its leaves are typically ovate with a rough texture and a distinct aromatic scent. Neisosperma poweri is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments.
